intro: Pyrenoglyphis concinna var. depauperata, commonly known as the slender sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
